title: Phase Aberration Correction without Reference Data: An Adaptive Mixed Loss Deep Learning Approach. (arXiv:2303.05747v1 [eess.IV])
abstract: Phase aberration is one of the primary sources of image quality degradation in ultrasound, which is induced by spatial variations in sound speed across the heterogeneous medium. This effect disrupts transmitted waves and prevents coherent summation of echo signals, resulting in suboptimal image quality. In real experiments, obtaining non-aberrated ground truths can be extremely challenging, if not infeasible. It hinders the performance of deep learning-based phase aberration correction techniques due to sole reliance on simulated data and the presence of domain shift between simulated and experimental data. Here, for the first time, we propose a deep learning-based method that does not require reference data to compensate for the phase aberration effect. We train a network wherein both input and target output are randomly aberrated radio frequency (RF) data. ret.translated_title: 无参考数据下的相位像差校正：一种自适应混合损失深度学习方法
ret.translated_abstract: 相位畸变是超声图像质量退化的主要原因之一，它由介质中声速空间变化引起。这种影响干扰了传输波并防止回波信号的相干叠加，导致子优的图像质量。在实际实验中，获取非畸变的基本真相可能极具挑战性，甚至不可行。由于仅依赖于模拟数据和模拟与实验数据之间的域偏移存在，这会阻碍基于深度学习的相位像差校正技术的性能。在这里，我们首次提出了一种不需要参考数据来补偿相位畸变效应的基于深度学习的方法。我们训练了一个网络，其中输入和目标输出都是随机畸变的射频(RF)数据。此外，我们证明了像均方误差这样的传统损失函数对训练网络的不足。
ret.tldr: 该论文提出了一种不需要参考数据来补偿相位畸变效应的基于深度学习的方法，训练网络用于修复随机畸变的射频数据，同时证明传统损失函数的不足。
